title: Drawing, "Design for Wall Decoration, Possibly for Lobby or Vicinity South of Dining Room", 1802 or earlier
medium: Watercolor, pen and ink on paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Vertical rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. Design for a section of a wall showing four narrow vertical panels containing painted lattice-work designs. Smaller panels above and below bear scroll designs. Narrow columns at ends of the wall.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Wall Decoration, Possibly for Lobby or Vicinity South of Dining Room", 1802 or earlier.
1802 or earlier. Watercolor, pen and ink on paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-57.
